intro: Brunoniella pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing delicate white or pale blue flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Brunoniella pumilio is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and ease of care.
